work.name: Hendrix College
work.summary: I have been a teaching assitant for the introductory computer science courses at my college for several years. In these classes, I have been exposed to some of the common problems that students have when learning new languages, and I have developed my interest in education.

work.name: Disco Tray Studios
work.summary: Disco Tray Studios is a software development studio run by Dr. Mark Goadrich at Hendrix College. It employs students to develop websites, games, and mobile apps for members of the community around Hendrix. I worked for Disco Tray Studios on the Water Quality Testing and Lake Nixon Scheduling Apps.

projects.name: H-Intercal
projects.summary: H-Intercal is an Intercal-72 interpreter implemented in Haskel. It includes a small selection of extra features from the C-Intercal specification as well.

projects.name: disco
projects.summary: As an undergraduate research project, I contributed to the open-source programming language disco. disco is a teaching language designed to help students learn discrete math. It is emplyed in the discrete math classes at Hendrix College, where I study.
